You can mention me by writing @Reinachan

I'm a database mod on Kitsu that add new and upcoming anime as well as obscure ones. Also dabbles in the community.

 - connoisseur of anything cute. 

I've studied music technology and want to become a music producer.

I write about anime, video games, live-action, and an occasional shitpost.

findProfileBySlug.name: Queen Reina

nodes.content: And with that, I finished my 400th anime, just in time before the new year. What a great movie! Solid animation, beautiful art, amazing music, and a great load of cartoony fun! I loved this movie! It might not be my favourite of his works or anything, nor go into my favourites, but it was most definitely worth the spot as my 400th anime!
Did you know Solid Snake from Metal Gear Solid voices Lupin in this movie?
Congrats to completing 400, hope you get to 500 before the next new year.
@283847 I have a feeling I won‚Äôt. Unless I get back into watching a lot of anime again. I kinda lost motivation lately. Well, I could probably do it easily if I binge shorts xD

@Energetic_Nova I did what you said last year, watched a bunch of shorts to get there. I think I had seen 392 anime or something already. Just wanted to watch that movie and reach 400 by the end of the year xD
Congrats to completing 400üéâüéâ
congrats.

As much as I have my qualms with AniList, them slowly starting to ban the word ¬´tr*p¬ª is one thing I‚Äôm really glad to see. They‚Äôve also handled it in a really good way, demonstrating why it‚Äôs a harmful word by going into the history of the word, while also coming with alternative words that reflect what the Japanese audience use. 

I hope this carries a ripple effect that will have an actual effect on the anime community as a whole! 

https://anilist.co/forum/thread/18498

Whatever happened to the saying "Sticks and stones may break my bones, but words shall never hurt me?"

That's not even going into how trap isn't even a slur.

Very bad take and awful authoritarian practice over on MAL.

Ah yes, the infamous transgender state-funded deathsquads must have slipped my mind due when I wrote that. I also forgot about my trans-icidal mindset as a user of the word trap. My bad.

It's really a slippery slope. One day I'm laughing at Astolfo memes and the next my hand slips and I accidentally shoot a trans person in the chest 37 times and it just keeps on going from there.

@ArtifexArdens It contributes to a mindset that gets trans people killed. 

And authoritarians kill trans people. We aren‚Äôt the authoritarians for not wanting to die.

Ah yes, the infamous transgender state-funded deathsquads must have slipped my mind due when I wrote that. I also forgot about my trans-icidal mindset as a user of the word trap. My bad.

It's really a slippery slope. One day I'm laughing at Astolfo memes and the next my hand slips and I accidentally shoot a trans person in the chest 37 times and it just keeps on going from there.

I think banning that word is being disingenuous when it comes to Japanese media. Japan is a transphobic country, and they are often very offensive in their misrepresentation of trans or transvestite people. Western media are so much better at giving those of us who are trans or transvestite a good and respectful treatment. Anime just isn‚Äôt there yet. They are still played off for offensive comedy and depicted as the dreaded ‚Äútrap.‚Äù
Don‚Äôt hate the term, hate the disgusting industry that still makes characters the term is meant to apply to.

@Reinachan addressing problems in a community can be difficult but J can only say they get better over time as people come to understand. I think I need to provide more examples of characters with trans narratives. Things people wont see if they are cis. I will happily be an ally to this. :)
The comments on this post have gotten pretty toxic :/

@Reinachan addressing problems in a community can be difficult but J can only say they get better over time as people come to understand. I think I need to provide more examples of characters with trans narratives. Things people wont see if they are cis. I will happily be an ally to this. :)

@Micaiah Yupp ... I really don‚Äôt understand how this is such a big problem ... But I guess this brings forward the transphobes. I‚Äôm kinda considering actually switching to AniList now because of this. But we‚Äôll see. I spent a lot of time customising my bio there at least xD
@Energetic_Nova please do!

@Reinachan ; - ; is this goodbye? Though in all seriousness I didn't know people got this heated on kitsu, might be my fault for sticking my head in the sand of my followers feed where all the people are nice for too long but ye ;;

I really liked this arc. I‚Äôd wish we could have a full-lenght anime on this girl alone because I really like her! 

Also, this season has been really good at not making it awkward that it‚Äôs all in first-person! The first season struggled a bit with that, but not this one!

No, it‚Äôs just you that is hot.

Also, I‚Äôm loving this new girl. She‚Äôs really cute and nice. Takes care about the plants and stuff. 

I‚Äôm glad to say that season 3 is kicking things off better than the previous two seasons!

**Pok√©mon (2019)**
*Episode 1 thoughts*

Now that it's finally been translated, I can talk a bit more about this without sounding like a fool because I only understood parts of the raw version.

This episode was really strong. It features a lot of visual storytelling with only minimal exposition that doesn't come off as obtrusive to me, but rather making sure that all kids understand what's going on. Most of it is conveyed through visuals and only some of it through dialogue and visuals on top. This is cool! I love how there's a long story with Pichu and the pok√©mon that lets him stay with them! And this kinda also explains to us why Pikachu didn't quite like Ash at first. 

Visually it's like Sun & Moon mostly. The backgrounds are very simple and not pretty at all. Honestly, they look kinda ugly ... However, as a result, there's also a lot more backgrounds and a ton more animation! Like, this episode has much more animation than I can remember any episode in Sun & Moon having. I'm impressed by how much there is! And it's not just that there's a lot, it's also high quality and expressive!

I don't like Ash's voice actor that much, nor do I like professor Oak's much either. I don't necessarily think they're bad or anything, just that I don't like them that much. Kana Hanazawa is doing a stellar job so far though. I love her as Koharu!

In general, I'm definitely looking forward to more of this, and if this is the quality it's going to be at, it's gonna be one fantastic ride!
@Reinachan /vp/ was in love with Serena and a few fight clips I saw looked really fun so I illwill do it first....just need to recover from BW anime PTSD

This was actually great, the art style retains the quick and bouncy style of sun and moon but changes the faces a tiny bit to try and mimic the style of the new game, which is a great upgrade. But the overall character animation and facial animation is what had me going because they were quite fluid and high quality. But yea, pokemon has always had lackluster backgrounds, so I get your point there. This has the potential to be a great new gen.
@Askar I saw a random episode of XY on TV iirc, and I didn't like it. But I love Sun & Moon tho
@Reinachan Yee I am still trying to gather the willpower to catch up with XY and SM, both looked pretty fun
I agree. So was Sun & Moon tbh. I'm glad at least the Pok√©mon anime is just getting better and better!
